title: Genetically engineered wheat releases insect pheromones to ward off pests

tasks.task: Conduct genetic modification to create pest-deterrent crops
subtasks: Identify a gene from peppermint for producing insect pheromones
Insert the gene into wheat plants
Test the modified wheat's volatile compounds for repellent effects
Use a multi-chambered olfactometer to assess aphid behavior
Observe time spent by aphids near the engineered wheat
Evaluate aphid dispersal triggered by alarm pheromones
Monitor the attraction of beneficial insects like parasitic wasps
Test the engineered wheat in field conditions over multiple seasons

Document aphid and beneficial insect populations on modified vs. regular wheat MAINTASK: Disseminate findings and refine the genetic engineering approach for broader application SUBTASK: Consider the success of the modification in controlled vs. field environments SUBTASK: Identify areas for improvement to enhance field performance of pheromone-releasing crops MAINTASK: Discuss potential applications beyond crop protection SUBTASK: Explore use of pheromone engineering to control disease-spreading insects in animals and humans
